title: Kirby 3: XSLT Templating
body:
**Url:** https://github.com/hananils/kirby-xslt

### Information

We work as designers, and over the years we have fallen in love with XSLT for templating. XSLT allows you to transform XML to any other structure by applying templates and thus you can use it to generate HTML from structured data. The syntax looks like HTML and works like CSS conceptually.

This plugin enables XSLT templating in your Kirby install by generating XML for all front-end pages. You can setup custom nodes and specify included elements for each page.

title: Kirby3 Well-Known
body:
https://github.com/omz13/kirby3-wellknown

### Information

This plugin generates `/robots.txt` for you (and it works nicely with interacts with [omz13/kirby3-xmlsitemap](https://github.com/omz13/kirby3-xmlsitemap) so that pesky sitemap data is automatically generated for you!) . It also allows you to generate txt files in `/.well-known` so you can provide security.txt, dnt-policy.txt, humans.txt, or another txt based file in that folder. A blueprint is provided to make customising the panel for these as painless as possible (YMMV).

title: Kirby 3 HoneHome
body:
https://github.com/omz13/kirby3-honehome

### Information

This plugin does _things_ to the homepage. You will want this plugin when:

- You are running a multi-language site and you want:
  - the homepage (default or replaced) to _automagically_ switch to the language set by a browser's `Accept-Language` header (instead of defaulting to the site's default language). This is seriously cool.
  - pages to have the correct `lang` attribute (because it contains a helper function to do that what has to be done).
- You want to replace the homepage with a different page (e.g. for a blog-based site you would set this to the parent page for the blog posts).

title: kirby-webpack
body:
kirby-webpack

A kirby starter-kit with modern frontend tools



> Kirby is a file-based CMS. Easy to setup. Easy to use. Flexible as hell. But it lacks the frontend tools ; especially if you're more a front than a back developper. **Kirby-webpack** wraps PHP and [Kirby CMS](http://getkirby.com) inside a full pre-configured [npm](npmjs.com) + [Webpack](https://webpack.github.io/) environnement.
**About:** [forum.getkirby.com](https://forum.getkirby.com/t/kirby-webpack-a-kirby-starter-kit-with-modern-frontend-tools/8695) **Github:** [brocessing/kirby-webpack](https://github.com/brocessing/kirby-webpack)

title: STOMT plugin for Kirby
body: ## Collect feedback and build a community via STOMT ### About Create a user-account on [stomt.com/signup](https://www.stomt.com/signup) and then [create a page for your project](https://www.stomt.com/createTarget). You can then use our website widgets to collect feedback from your website. The feedback will be collected on STOMT where your audience can vote the feedback and where you can react and manage it in a transparent way. **Site:** [STOMT.com](https://www.stomt.com) **Github:** [STOMT for Kirby](https://github.com/stomt/stomt-kirby-extension) **Demo:** [STOMT Widgets Showcase](https://stomt.co/web) ### Use-Cases STOMT itself collects feedback [from their blog](https://www.stomt.com/blog) to their [blogs STOMT page](https://www.stomt.com/stomt-blog). The game "Empires of the Undergrowth" [links to their STOMT page](http://eotugame.com) and uses the integration in-game and [on their forum](http://forum.eotugame.com) (to reduce feedback related discussions). ### Costs: Free There will be premium features on the STOMT platform. ### Screenshots from the different widgets

This plugin generates base64-encoded cryptographic hashes for your css / js files based on their content and adds them to the integrity attribute of their corresponding <script> or <link>elements. `kirby-sri` also applies cache-busting / fingerprinting.

body:

> This Kirby CMS plugin will extend [Parsedown](http://parsedown.org/) or [Parsedown Extra](https://github.com/erusev/parsedown-extra) (Kirby's [Markdown](https://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/) parsers) functionality to turn all images into figures with captions. This is done by modifying the way in which images are parsed and wrapping them in `<figure>` tags, while adding either the **title text** or **alt text** fields (in that order of priority) as the figure's caption wrapped in `<figcaption>` tags below the image.

### Blueprint:
```yaml
fields:
    cropselect:
        label:  Select crop position
        type:   cropselect
```

### Template:
```php
$image->crop(100, 200, $image->cropselect());
```

title: Kirby-Opener
body:
**GitHub** https://github.com/bnomei/kirby-opener

> Kirby Opener is a Kirby CMS Panel Field button that allows you to use placeholders to create dynamic urls which are called with and without ajax response or start downloads. 

**NOTE:** This is not a free plugin. In order to use it on a production server, you need to buy a license.

## Key Features

- open any URL from within the panel
- add custom data within the URL using placeholders
- display custom JSON response status messages at the button label
- trigger downloading of files
- easily extendable placeholders
- configural parsing of json response

[greetings firstname="Peter" lastname="Parker"] [hello] This is a tag inside a tag. Kirby *markdown* can be used inside a tag. Html can be used as well! title: ImageKit â€“ asynchronous thumbs API
body: **Github:** https://github.com/fabianmichael/kirby-imagekit > mageKit provides an asynchronous thumbnail API and advanced image optimization for [Kirby CMS](http://getkirby.com). > > **NOTE:** This is not a free plugin. In order to use it on a production server, you need to buy a license. For details on ImageKitâ€™s license model, have a look at the `readme.md` and the `license.md` files of the plugin. ## Key Features - **Image-resizing on demand:** Kirbyâ€™s built-in thumbnail engine resizes images on-the-fly while executing the code in your template files. On image-heavy pages, the first page-load can take very long or even exceed the maximum execution time of PHP. ImageKit resizes images only on-demand as soon as they are requested by the client. - **Optimization:** ImageKit can utilize several command-line utilities to apply superior compression to your images. Both lossless and lossy optimizers are available. Your images look as shiny as before, but your pages will load much faster.* - **Security:** A lot of thumbnail libraries for PHP still offer the generation of resized images through URL parameters (e.g. `thumbnail.php?file=ambrosia.jpg&width=500`), which is a potential vector for DoS attacks. ImageKit only generates the thumbnails whose are defined in your page templates. - **Widget:** Pre-Generate your thumbnails right from the panel with a single click. - **Discovery Feature:** The widget scans you whole site for new thumbnails, before creating them. - **Error-Handling:** ImageKit letâ€™s you know, when errors occur during thumbnail creation *(experimental)*. - **Self-Hosted:** Unlike many other image-resizing-services, ImageKit just sits in Kirbyâ€™s plugin directory, so you have everything under control without depending on external providers. No monthly fees. No visitor data is exposed to external companies. tl;dr: No bullshit! The plugin will be extended by a responsive image component in the future with support for lazy-loading and placeholders (like on ). Those features will be released as a separate plugin. You can get a discount, when you buy both plugins as a bundle. *) To use optimization features, your need to have the corresponding command-line utilities installed on your server or have sufficient permissions to install them. The effectiveness of compression also depends heavily on your source images. --- ![imagekit-widget](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/395617/16609729/99af317c-4356-11e6-93a5-4b242d255faf.gif)

title: Blade template component
body:
**Github:** https://github.com/pedroborges/kirby-blade-template

> Laravel Blade template component for Kirby CMS.

To learn more about Blade syntax, visit the [documentation](https://laravel.com/docs/master/blade).

> Blade is the simple, yet powerful templating engine provided by Laravel. Unlike other popular PHP templating engines, Blade does not restrict you from using plain PHP code in your views. In fact, all Blade views are compiled into plain PHP code and cached until they are modified, meaning Blade adds essentially zero overhead to your site.

Blade view files use the `.blade.php` file extension and are typically stored in the `site/templates` directory.

**This component extends Kirby's built-in templating engine. Any regular `.php` template will continue to works as usual.**

https://github.com/bartvandebiezen/kirby-v2-scssphp

> This is a preprocessor for SCSS files. Built using the scssphp library by Leaf Corcoran. This Kirby 2 plugin will automatically process SCSS files when changed. As an option, you can use this plugin to create 'critical CSS'.

title: Lessphp Plugin for Kirby 2
body:
https://github.com/bartvandebiezen/kirby-v2-lessphp

> This is a preprocessor for Less files. Built using the lessphp library by Josh Schmidt and lessphp plugin for Kirby 1 by Jan Stieler. This plugin will automatically process Less files when changed.

title: Kirby Task List
body:
https://github.com/groenewege/kirby-task-list

> This plugin extends Kirby 2 with some basic and extremely easy to use taks-list formatting. The plugin enables the inclusion of github style task lists in Kirby content.

title: Kirby Auto Publish
body:
https://github.com/groenewege/kirby-auto-publish

> This plugin extends Kirby with the possibility to auto publish pages that are created with the Kirby Admin Panel.

title: Analytics plugin for Kirby
body:
https://github.com/iksi/KirbyAnalytics

> Adds a Google Analytics code automatically as soon as the site is not running on localhost.

title: Figure plugin
body:
https://github.com/studiodumbar/kirby-extensions/tree/master/plugins/figure

> A plugin for Kirby CMS that generates an image in a figure tag, with a lot of options: among others crop ratio, alt-tag and (an opinionated) lazyload setting.

title: Imgsrc plugin
body:
https://github.com/studiodumbar/kirby-extensions/tree/master/plugins/imgsrc

> A plugin for Kirby CMS that generates an src attribute only. Handy for creating an img tag or for use as background image url.

title: Embed plugin for Kirby
body:
https://github.com/iksi/KirbyEmbed

> Adds dynamic embedding for YouTube, Vimeo, MixCloud, SoundCloud and Spotify. Custom tag creates a container with an anchor instead of an embed code. After the page is loaded a javascript parses all these tags and fetches the embed codes by calling an oEmbed PHP class that makes a curl request.

title: Kirby sitemap.xml Plugin
body:
https://github.com/thgh/kirby-plugins/tree/master/sitemap

> This plugin generates sitemap.xml. It's possible to exclude pages from the sitemap and to assign which pages should have the highest priority.

> A simple tag for Kirby CMS which lets you output the current day. It's multi-language ready and it has some options.

title: Tagunslug plugin
body:

> A plugin for Kirby CMS to convert a tag slug (see tagslug plugin) string to a human readable tag name (e.g. convert interactive-and-web to Interactive & Web).
